SEARCH
Package Simulation

Class PEC

java.lang.Object
Simulation.PEC
All Implemented Interfaces:
PECInterface
public class PEC extends Object implements PECInterface
This class is responsible for defining the Priority Event Collection (PEC) and its properties.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PEC(Parameters parameters)
    The PEC constructor initializes a priority queue that stores events in the order of their time.

  • Constructor Details

    • PEC

      public PEC(Parameters parameters)
      The PEC constructor initializes a priority queue that stores events in the order of their time. It enables real-time simulation and allows events to be added at any point during the simulation. The PEC ensures that events are processed in the order of their arrival times, preventing conflicts between them.
      Parameters:
      parameters - The simulation parameters

  • Method Details

    • addEvent

      public void addEvent(Event event)
      Adds an event to the Priority Event Collection (PEC).
      Specified by:
      addEvent in interface PECInterface
      Parameters:
      event - The event to be added to the PEC

    • nextPECEvent

      public void nextPECEvent()
      Runs the next event in the Priority Event Collection (PEC). It retrieves the next event from the PEC, updates the current time to match the event's simulation time, and executes the event's run function.
      Specified by:
      nextPECEvent in interface PECInterface

    • run

      public void run()
      The main loop of the simulation. It continues running until there are no more events in the Priority Event Collection (PEC), and then it prints a summary of all events that occurred during the simulation.
      Specified by:
      run in interface PECInterface

    • getCurrentTime

      public double getCurrentTime()
      Returns the current time of the simulation.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentTime in interface PECInterface
      Returns:
      The current time

    • getPec

      public static PriorityQueue<Event> getPec()
      Returns the Priority Event Collection (PEC).
      Returns:
      The Priority Event Collection
